p: Currently, the proliferation process of carriers in the high electric field region is dominated by Schottky effect (electrode effect) and Poole–Frenkel effect (body effect) [ 33], and the charge transport mechanism is dominated by electron jump conductance [ 34]. In order to study the change of the conductivity mechanism of the four different density polyethylenes under high field strength at room temperature (25 °C), the mechanism of the above two high field strengths is briefly introduced.
